title: Sans with Discretionary Ligatures ?
content:
Can you please suggest some good contemporary sans or humanist sans that comes with discretionary ligatures like (st, ct etc..).

Some similar style typo like Today Sans, Precious Sans or Foundry Sterling but with ligatures (something like Leitura from DSType has).

Thnx in advance :)
author: owb

comments.content:
Bree  
Carmina  
Ronnia  
FF Meta Pro  
FF Nuvo  
FF Unit  
…
[Aspect](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014851/http:/typography.net/type/font/aspect) has a huge variety of ligatures.

Thanks everybody for suggestions.... There are few nice solutions like Graublau Sans...  
But stil I feel I can't find perfect match. The thing is that i'm looking for font that has more monospaced look ( especially "wider" look in italics that are important to me ) that can be found in Foudndry Sterling or Precous Sans. Also I'm looking that letter "a" is more proportional.

Like these ex in Sterling:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014851im_/http:/typophile.com/files/f1_5995.jpg)
 
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018014851im_/http:/typophile.com/files/f1_a_5162.jpg)

Or Precious:

Well, if you contact me I could certainly do what you are looking for in Precious Sans...

Strange user details you have there Owb.

Nick Cooke

<cite>Strange user details you have there Owb.</cite>

Strange, but still decipherable! :D  
Zg is Zagreb, HR is Croatia (Hrvatska).

Ah! I see, pardon my ignorance. What about Owb? is that a name?

Nick Cooke
I have to pass on that one. ;-)

Florian deciphered correctly location and owb is my nickname, simple :)

Nick, thank you very much for the offer but I managed to find another solution at the moment.
